title: ICE when re-exporting proc macro from renamed crate (wasm32-unknown-unknown)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The compiler panics when trying to re-export a proc-macro, and the crate that contains this macro is renamed in the `Cargo.toml`:
```
my = { package = "my-proc-macro", path = "./macro" }
```
Fails when targeting `wasm32-unknown-unknown`, haven't tested any other targets though.

The code here contains a minimal reproduction example:
https://github.com/tomusdrw/proc-macro-reexport

## Meta

```
$ rustc --version --verbose
rustc 1.38.0 (625451e37 2019-09-23)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 625451e376bb2e5283fc4741caa0a3e8a2ca4d54
commit-date: 2019-09-23
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.38.0
LLVM version: 9.0
```
(but happens on 1.40-nightly too)

Backtrace:
